steps.title: Avoid tight or clingy clothes to distract the eye.
steps.content: Avoid tight or clingy clothes to distract the eye. Overly form-fitting garments can bring unwanted attention to excess fat around the midsection. Instead, choose fabrics and styles that have a bit more give and stretch to them. [1] X Research source Lycra, satin, and jersey fabrics will all cling to the body in an unflattering manner, while sturdy cotton, velvet, and wool blends make for forgiving garments. [2] X Research source Tops or dresses with draping are a good options, as well as sweaters in cashmere or a lightweight cotton.

steps.title: Embrace dark colors for a slimming effect.
steps.content: Embrace dark colors for a slimming effect. Black, charcoal, navy, and brown create the illusion of a smaller frame while also hiding wrinkles and any pulling or bulging of fabric. [3] X Research source If your midsection is larger than your bottom half, create a more proportionate look by wearing dark clothing on top and lighter colors on the bottom, such as khaki pants.

steps.title: Choose clothing that accentuates your best features.
steps.content: Choose clothing that accentuates your best features. Play to your strengths by highlighting your arms, shoulders, or any other part of your body that makes you feel confident. It will draw the attention away from your belly and toward your favorite qualities! [4] X Research source A sleeveless top will highlight your arms and shoulders. A low-cut shirt will accentuate your neckline. Shorts or a dress or skirt above the knees will show off your legs. A T-shirt can display strong arms. Slim ankles can be showed off with a pair of cropped pants

steps.title: Wear pants with a mid- or high-rise waistline to naturally cinch your waistline.
steps.content: Wear pants with a mid- or high-rise waistline to naturally cinch your waistline. Low-rise fashions can have a push-up effect on your belly fat, making it more prominent. High-waisted styles will hug in any love handles or belly pooches. [5] X Research source Pair high-waisted pants with a simple blouse without too much volume for a sleek look. Avoid wearing a short jacket with high-waisted pants, which can create a boxy effect.

steps.title: Choose tops with draping, pleats, or frills to disguise excess fat.
steps.content: Choose tops with draping, pleats, or frills to disguise excess fat. A shirt that has extra fabric and texture will trick the eye and hide the bulge around your belly. [6] X Research source A top with a lot of detail and fabric pairs perfectly with simple bottoms, like a classic pair of black trousers or a pencil skirt.

steps.title: Layer on a jacket or a cardigan to cover up belly fat.
steps.content: Layer on a jacket or a cardigan to cover up belly fat. Use a long sweater or jacket to create long lean lines, pulling the eye away from your belly and lengthening your appearance. [7] X Research source Try a poncho or a long sweater with a waterfall hemline for a bohemian look, as long as you pair it with a form-fitting garment on the bottom, such as a legging or skinny pant. For a more masculine look, wear a blazer for a more formal occasion or a leather bomber jacket for a casual style. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Try a shirt or dress with an empire waistline to emphasize a small waist.
steps.content: Try a shirt or dress with an empire waistline to emphasize a small waist. An empire waistline cinches at your most narrow point, right below the ribcage, accentuating your waist and skimming your belly. You can make any loose top or dress into an empire waist by belting it around your ribcage. [9] X Research source A dress or top with an asymmetrical waistline can have a similar lengthening effect. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Wear shapewear underneath your clothing to smooth your midsection.
steps.content: Wear shapewear underneath your clothing to smooth your midsection. Specially formulated elastic undergarments can reshape your stomach, pulling in your belly fat and making your clothes fit better. A high-waisted short or a fitted camisole is a good way to smooth the entire midsection. Pair soft leggings with a long shirt or tunic for a more comfortable and stylish way to tuck in your tummy. [11] X Research source Under a sweater or button down, wear a specially-designed elastic shapewear shirt to eliminate bulging.

steps.title: Tailor your clothes for a better overall fit.
steps.content: Tailor your clothes for a better overall fit. Taking in your garments to accommodate your midsection while properly fitting the rest of your body creates a much slimmer look.

steps.title: Wear bold accessories around your neck to draw the eye up.
steps.content: Wear bold accessories around your neck to draw the eye up. This will place the emphasis on the upper half of your torso. [12] X Research source Wear a chunky statement necklace or a top with a bold, detailed neckline Opt for shirts with broad collars and tie larger knots in their ties, such as a full windsor. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Choose a wider tie.
steps.content: Choose a wider tie. A tie with larger overall width will balance out the midsection and create a more proportional and balanced appearance. Your tie should fall right at the upper line of your belt so that it doesn't give the appearance of not being able to reach over your belly.

steps.title: Carry a purse with longer straps to elongate the body.
steps.content: Carry a purse with longer straps to elongate the body. The straps will create a long and lean visual effect and draw attention down to where the bag ends, past your hips. [14] X Research source Crossbody bags, satchels with long handles, and hobo purses are all good options.

steps.title: Wear a pair of suspenders.
steps.content: Wear a pair of suspenders. Suspenders are a better alternative to a belt by holding up your pants up without pinching or creating a bulge around the top of your pants. Suspenders also create 2 long vertical lines on the body, drawing the eye up and lengthening the appearance of your torso.

steps.title: Top off your outfit with a hat to add more length.
steps.content: Top off your outfit with a hat to add more length. A stylish hat is an easy way to add a little more height to your frame, automatically balancing out any extra weight around the middle. [15] X Research source Sun hats, fedoras with wide brims, or flat caps are all great options.

steps.title: Pull in your tummy.
steps.content: Pull in your tummy. Sucking your stomach muscles to your spine immediately flattens your belly. Additionally, the action of pulling your stomach in will support your spine and help prevent any back problems that can arise from carrying extra weight. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Square your shoulders and lift your chest.
steps.content: Square your shoulders and lift your chest. This action will create the look of a wider top and smaller waistline. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Keep your back straight.
steps.content: Keep your back straight. Maintaining a straight or slight s-curve in your spine will help you appear slimmer and prevent your stomach from sticking out. [18] X Research source Avoid over-arching your back. Don't slouch, which will prevent you from tucking your stomach in and will make your belly look bigger than it actually is. [19] X Research source

steps.title: Wear a heeled shoe to automatically stand up straighter.
steps.content: Wear a heeled shoe to automatically stand up straighter. Wearing heels naturally improves your posture by rotating your hips to tuck your bottom in and helping keep your back and shoulder straight. Even a classic dress shoe with a small heel can be enough to reap these benefits.
